Posts.Content: texasrose361 wrote: I am having a hard time with my diagnosis mainly because i am so young. I am 27 w/ 2 children, 2 and 5 and i was told that my cancer has spread to my ribs and sternum area. what the heck?!?! how could it have spread so quickly? i am angry because no one wanted to believe i even had bc for a yr now and kept saying it was a breastfeeding issue. i feel so failed by the drs i've seen! i dont think its fair 2 my kids or even that i'm fair 2 them. i am so stressed that i actually yelled at them! typically not ME! Children 10g, 10b, 8b :) Mets to ribs, sternum, femur, esophagus, retroperitoneal LN, lungs, ocular nerve, brain. Dx 7/22/2010, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Serious denial... texasrose361 texasrose361

Posts.Content: texasrose361 wrote: okay so the waiting is killing me, so i am glad that i'll get my results tomorrow. they took 2 diffrent samples from my lymphnodes (radiologist explained 2 type of samples were needed for 2 types of tests- bc and lympedemaa spelled totally wrong) anyhow then 2 different biopsy sites on my actual growth... its more like 2 ones hard and round like a pebble and the other is about a third of my breast size (dd) of hard thick tissue... so it went well and i am just waiting for the results... hope 4 B9! Children 10g, 10b, 8b :) Mets to ribs, sternum, femur, esophagus, retroperitoneal LN, lungs, ocular nerve, brain. Dx 7/22/2010, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: biopsy today, results tomorrow! texasrose361 Lisa1962

Posts.Content: texasrose361 wrote: so after spending the 28th-today in the hospital bad news bears- cancer in the brain and in my left eye musccle (we have six musccles apparently that control tyghe eye) I am literally waiting for my wheelchair to take me downstairs, just to drive to the radiation oncologist to getstarted on radiation today (of course today is the simulation appointment) Whoot whoot i feel so blessed my eye was acting up cuz the brain meds were so small- 1cm and they would have not given me problems for a long time. Thank God every second i get that my mets tend not to go in "traditional places" because they tend to get me scanned earlier than needed and i find major concerns before they become major!  I am blessed in so many wys! Children 10g, 10b, 8b :) Mets to ribs, sternum, femur, esophagus, retroperitoneal LN, lungs, ocular nerve, brain. Dx 7/22/2010, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Tammie??? texasrose361 Cathy2

Posts.Content: texasrose361 wrote: well since you've answered some in another thread i have to come up with other ones... 1: You're new to the boards- but I noticed that your orginanal dx date is in 2001, so what prompted you to come join? (I did read you were cancer free for 12 yrs so am assuming mets this year) 2: Whats one thing that we would NEVER guess about you in a million years? 3: Where would be your ideal vacation/getaway spot and why?  4: You mention that you have CP, do you think that has helped you "prepare" for dealing with all this medical junk? 5: You said you'd love a dog- what breed, why?  BONUS :I would love to add i think its awesome you mention God- a few scriptures that get me through life is Philippians 4:13 and Ephesians 6:11 WHAT IS YOUR FAVORITE(S)? Children 10g, 10b, 8b :) Mets to ribs, sternum, femur, esophagus, retroperitoneal LN, lungs, ocular nerve, brain. Dx 7/22/2010, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 5 questions - CancerCrusher texasrose361 barsco1963

Posts.Content: texasrose361 wrote: With each setback my husband gets more and more depresed. The good news used to cheer him up somewhat but now even that doesnt help. He refuses to go to the dr. or even a counsler. Recently he has mentioned wanting to die because he is so sad. He assured me he wouldnt kill himself because we have children, but in someones darkest hour who knows what they might do. He is hopeless and cannot see the light at the end of the tunnel. He has given up on God, wont even attend anymore, or listen to me if I mention God. His depression has even started effecting him physically. Pains in various parts of his body, change in bathroom habits and ED (he is only 35) What can i do? Have any of y'all had similar experinces? Children 10g, 10b, 8b :) Mets to ribs, sternum, femur, esophagus, retroperitoneal LN, lungs, ocular nerve, brain. Dx 7/22/2010, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: not sure where to post this Husband depressed texasrose361 texasrose361

Posts.Content: texasrose361 wrote: what more can i say? :) I am 27, married mother of 2. Suspected something was wrong in July of 09, u/s in august, breast specialist felt it was benign... i have been jumping through hoops since. HONESTLY I AM JUST GLAD WE GOT AN ANSWER! (not the answer i wanted to hear tho) All i know is the 2 biopsy in the nodes came back positive, so that has me worried... feel so numb, like i am observing someone else's life... my biopsy site next to the steri strips on my armpit itch like crazy is this normal? Children 10g, 10b, 8b :) Mets to ribs, sternum, femur, esophagus, retroperitoneal LN, lungs, ocular nerve, brain. Dx 7/22/2010, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: WOW so numb- IDC & node biopsy positive texasrose361 texasrose361

Posts.Content: texasrose361 wrote: My latest scans; NED from the neck down and the brain mets are stable. Later this month i have more scans. I see my dr. friday :) and of course chemo to follow. Been busy with school and th kids, but doing well! Children 10g, 10b, 8b :) Mets to ribs, sternum, femur, esophagus, retroperitoneal LN, lungs, ocular nerve, brain. Dx 7/22/2010, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: checking in texasrose361 voraciousreader

Posts.Content: texasrose361 wrote: Sorry everyone... I have had a hard time emotionally "accepting" my stage 4 dx. Recently my sister in law did the whole BS drama thing on facebook and in real life and its been an emotional roller coaster. I mean i feel better now, but there are still times when i am all alone and get to thinking.... There are so many survivors with stage 4 that live long and healthy lives, and on the flip side there are many that just didn't get a dx in time. Because i had this lump for over a year before a dr took my concerns serious and then was ultimately DX i think maybe i could be one of those ppl that just didnt catch it in time :( With my follow up scans (to check up on the mets) looming ahead i am back to the thinking about it all the time phase. (sorta like when i was first dx)  I dont know why i have stayed away, maybe me staying away from this board makes me feel like i am not really dealing with cancer. Some one said it best when they said "Cancer Sucks!" it truly does and then again it has a plus side- like meeting all these wonderful people on the boards that are so loving and giving that share things that they would have never thought they would in a million years! Sorry i guess i just needed to vent a little... :) Children 10g, 10b, 8b :) Mets to ribs, sternum, femur, esophagus, retroperitoneal LN, lungs, ocular nerve, brain. Dx 7/22/2010, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Feel like that flaky friend texasrose361 X3sMom

Posts.Content: texasrose361 wrote: Just wondering how many of us stage 4 gals are under 30? I know its rarer to have cancer in your 20s than 50s and 60s and even rarer to have metastatic cancer, but just wondering :) Hello- I am 27, was DX in July I will be 28 in a month, found my mass over a year ago so I was 26... well it wouldnt prob have been stage IV then lol... I'd love to hear from you!!!! Edited to say early 30s too but it wont let me edit the title- sorry :) Children 10g, 10b, 8b :) Mets to ribs, sternum, femur, esophagus, retroperitoneal LN, lungs, ocular nerve, brain. Dx 7/22/2010, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Will definitely update Children 10g, 10b, 8b :) Mets to ribs, sternum, femur, esophagus, retroperitoneal LN, lungs, ocular nerve, brain. Posts.Title: WHOOP WHOOP!! texasrose361 chrissyb

Posts.Content: texasrose361 wrote: Hey y'all I am totally wrapped up in myself lately and whats going on in my life sp here is a run down. I quit school- long story My dad died pretty much unexpectedly. he was in the hospital for 3 weeks then went home on hospice to pass at home  which he did within a week Have this crazy lung thing at first they thought it was pluera effusion???? but it turns out my lungs (pluera and bronchi) are hardened from apparently the radiation. doing sterodial inhaler for 2 months to see if that helps. um pretty much doing good :) i think of y'all often!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Children 10g, 10b, 8b :) Mets to ribs, sternum, femur, esophagus, retroperitoneal LN, lungs, ocular nerve, brain. Dx 7/22/2010, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: An update :) texasrose361 ma111

Posts.Content: texasrose361 wrote: Hey all, I am the second oldest of 4 girls (35, 30, 28 and 26) my 28 year old sister sometimes has a hard time with my dx... Well back story our eldest sister is our half sister, she really resents our childhood and just cant cope- she basically isnt in our lives at all. Lots of bad blood between us.... the 26 year old is a heroine addict, currently she is in jail, she had gotten sober, went through a rehab and was doing amazingly well, she lived with my 28 yr old sister, took care of her kids and all that, she relapsed about a year ago and they (26 and 28) no longer speak. the 28 yr old doesnt want to enable my 26yr old sister so had given her an ultimatum- "either your friends and drugs, or me and my kids"- she picked drugs.... Me I am the glue LOL- well my 28 yr old sister said that if the other 2 sisters dont get their lives straightened out that once i die she will not see nor talk to either of them at all..... Her reasons as she puts it are "i have one sister who want to live a great life, but she was dealt a hand out of her control that is going to take her early from life, whereas the other one chose to kill herself by sticking needles in her arm, while the other one get her life on track enough to keep her children safe. (very long back story which could be made into a book!) We live in totally different states (them being in WA and me in TX) My delima is that i dont know what to say or do... I am not a come cry on my shoulder for comfort type of person LOL i will say suck it up. I am a laugh til it stops hurting kind of person. I will joke or kid about the situation to make ppl forget about the bad stuff...I dont want whatever time i have left with her to be shadowed by grief. Shoot i am living my life to the fullest, but i know she isnt. SHe is totally thinking this might be the last time i see my sister, or last time we do this or that.... Any progression or bad news i feel guilty sharing with her, but aside from my husband is is my best friend. I've written a few goodbye letters to others (mostly my kids and husband and a few special friends) but i cannot being myself to write her anything...... Funny what set off my thinking was i bought this random vase full of jewlery and was going through it- inside was a rubber bracelet that says "Imagine life without breast cancer", i have a care package for her and her kids so i thought i'd throw that in there for her...  Any ideas or tips on what i should do? Children 10g, 10b, 8b :) Mets to ribs, sternum, femur, esophagus, retroperitoneal LN, lungs, ocular nerve, brain. Dx 7/22/2010, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My sister... what to do? texasrose361 texasrose361

Posts.Content: texasrose361 wrote: Hey all- i finished my tx with gemzar and scans looked good, but had this persistant cough that just wouldnt go away. My right lung showed what appeared to be bronchitis but it didnt respond to antibiotics so my onc ordered a bronchoscopy and biopsy. Besides the fact that the biopsy punctured my lung and i had to be hospitalized for a pnemothorax, it also confirmed breast cancer was in my lung. Dr said it was presenting weird in the fact that is basically is a thin film of breast cancer coating my lung.... Going to start xeloda and tykerb as soon as inssurance approaval comes in. Oh and something else strange he (my onc) said it was no longer er+????? that could explain why i had progression in the first place (they did not biopsy those areas just started on treatment) i just cant wait to be able to breath again! thanks for listening! Children 10g, 10b, 8b :) Mets to ribs, sternum, femur, esophagus, retroperitoneal LN, lungs, ocular nerve, brain. Dx 7/22/2010, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Keep rollin with the punches texasrose361 texasrose361
